question: Which of the following preprocessing techniques is used to handle missing data: a) mean imputation b) mode imputation c) dropping rows with missing values d) none of the above
options: Which of the following is a drawback of label encoding: a) it introduces artificial ordinality b) it is computationally expensive c) it only works for binary variables d) none of the above
What is the purpose of target encoding in categorical encoding: a) reduce dimensionality b) handle high cardinality features c) improve model performance d) introduce random noise
When should outlier removal be performed during the preprocessing stage: a) before feature scaling b) after feature scaling c) it doesn't matter d) only for numerical features
In feature engineering, what is the purpose of one-hot encoding: a) handle missing data b) preserve ordinal relationships c) convert categorical variables into numerical ones d) reduce dimensionality
correct_answer: Which of the following is a drawback of label encoding: a) it introduces artificial ordinality b) it is computationally expensive c) it only works for binary variables d) none of the above
